ygData.subject: Re: Why I like being a monk
ygData.msgSnippet: they consent you. you target it and do the /corpse command ... From: Dave Gaines  To:  Sent: Friday, October 08, 1999
ygData.messageBody:
they consent you. you target it and do the /corpse command


----- Original Message -----
From: Dave Gaines <dave@...>
To: <EQ-Monks@onelist.com>
Sent: Friday, October 08, 1999 1:47 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ-Monks] Why I like being a monk


> From: Dave Gaines <dave@...>
>
> How do you pull another persons corpse?
>
> >
> > From: JnglSkyPWR@...
> >
> > There are many reasons I love playing a monk. Yes we make great
pullers.
> > You can go to Rodcet Nife and anybody I've grouped with who they think
the
> > best puller is. They will say a monk. When I pull, there is no
downtime, at
> > least for me. If I'm not fighting a mob, I'm busy pulling one. I
haven't
> > grouped with anybody that can keep the pace like myself. Another
reason, I
> > love to dish out the damage. At lvl 49 my max punch is 53, and kick
104,
> > without buffs. The max dmg I've done in one round, 4 punches and a
kick, was
> > 224. And this was to a lvl 45 mob, not some lil green guy. Another
thing
> > we're great at that isn't so fun is corpse recovery. I can run into
anywhere
> > and FD, change views and look for the corpse, if it's not there, stand,
run,
> > FD, look. Once you get the corpse, drag it where ever is needed. I was
on
> > PoF alone, running all over dragging corpses to the hill to be ressed
when we
> > brought the cleric in. Even if a mob aggros you, it will walk off after
a
> > lil bit. And if they come back when you stand up, you still have time
to run
> > a ways until they get to you. In LG, I don't need invis vs undead to
get
> > out, or to get into a party already camping something. Yes, it helps,
but I
> > don't need it, just run, FD, wait, run again. These are the reasons I
love
> > playing a monk. If you have any questions, or can think of something
you've
> > heard of that I haven't mentioned, plz ask, and I'll do my best to fill
you
> > in.
> >
> > Kanja
> > Rodcet Nife
> >
> > >
>
> >
